Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic analyses reveal two new
species of Sporocadaceae from Hainan, China
Abstract:
Species of Sporocadaceae have often been reported as plant
pathogens, endophytes or saprophytes and are commonly isolated from a
wide range of plant hosts. Nine strains were isolated from Schima
superba, Ficus microcarpa and Ilex chinensis in Hainan Province, China
and their ITS-tub2-tef1 sequence based phylogeny and morphology were
analyzed. They represented four species, viz, Monochaetia schimae sp.
nov., Neopestalotiopsis haikouensis sp. nov., Neopestalotiopsis piceana
and Pestalotiopsis licualacola.
